Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: நல்லவை எல்லாஅந் தீயவாம் தீயவும் நல்லவாம் செல்வம் செயற்கு.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: In the acquisition of property, every thing favourable becomes unfavourable, and (on the other hand) everything unfavourable becomes favourable, (through the power of fate).

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A massive, ancient, stone Wheel of Fortune stands vertically. The left side of the wheel is ascending, while the right side is descending.
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the ascending side, dark thorny vines ('தீயவை') are miraculously transforming into golden, fruit-bearing branches ('நல்லவாம்'). On the descending side, the golden branches are withering back into dark thorns ('நல்லவை தீயவாம்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The wheel is set against a dramatic sky, half stormy and half clear, reflecting the unpredictable turns of fate in the pursuit of wealth ('செல்வம் செயற்கு').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The power of fate to invert outcomes in the pursuit of wealth, turning good efforts into bad results and bad situations into good ones.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The Wheel of Fortune is the central metaphor for fate. The transformation of thorns to gold and vice-versa illustrates the inversion of good ('நல்லவை') and bad ('தீயவை').
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The ascending side is bathed in a hopeful, golden light. The descending side is cast in shadow and cool, ominous tones. The sky has a strong light/dark contrast.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Centered wide shot, capturing the full motion and transformation of the wheel.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, cinematic, with detailed textures on the stone wheel and magical transformation effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: High-contrast, dynamic lighting that seems to rotate with the wheel.

Cultural_Anchors: Inversion of good and bad outcomes

Negative_Prompt: static wheel, uniform lighting, happy figures, text artifacts, blurry, cartoonish vines.

Hyperparameters.seed: Explore variations for the transformation effect on the vines.
